11:29 <sburjan> vmassol: I have a technical question. Do you know if it is possible to retrieve programatically the database values we have in hibernate.cfg.xml ? I need the JDBC URL, username and password :)

11:29 <chalx> has joined #xwiki  
11:30 <sburjan> regarding my integration with XWiki + Activiti, I want to tell Activiti to use the same database as xwiki does. So when initializing Activiti I want to tell it to use the JDBC url, username and password defined in XWiki's hibernate.cfg.xml  
11:30 <vmassol> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Execute+SQL  
11:30 <vmassol> forget my link, it's not for your use case :)  
11:31 <vmassol> data source is the way to go I believe  
11:37 <sburjan> so I should look on how to obtain the Hibernate Datasrouce ?  
11:38 <vmassol> you don't need to obtain it, you just need to set one and then configure activitii to use it  
11:38 <vmassol> that should allow you to not have to define URL and credentials

11:38 <vmassol> and?  
11:38 <vmassol> datasource isn't related to hibernate  
11:39 <vmassol> google it  
11:39 <sburjan> ok  
11:39 <vmassol> there are plenty of tutorials

13:05 <sburjan> vmassol: I am looking at https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/store/DBCPConnectionProvider.java#L192 but unfortunately there is no method to getDataSource object  
13:07 <vmassol> I have noidea  
13:07 <vmassol> I don't think you need to get a data source  
13:07 <vmassol> that's not the way to do it  
13:07 <vmassol> you just need to defined a DS  
13:07 <vmassol> and pass its string name  
13:10 <sburjan> well I could define a ds object, but I still need to get the properties from somewhere (JDBC URL, username, password)  
13:11 <sburjan> I mwan I see that the configure method has a Properties parameter which is used to get all those, but I'll duplicate the code  
13:13 <vmassol> no  
13:13 <vmassol> the DS is defined outside of xwiki, nothing to do with xwiki  
13:13 <vmassol> it's a app server config  
13:13 <vmassol> and you create a name for it  
13:14 <vmassol> then you configure xwiki and activity to use that ds name  
13:14 <vmassol> no need for url, username, password  
13:15 <vmassol> example with jboss: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationJBoss#HUsingaJBossDataSource  
13:16 <vmassol> I won't be able to help you more than that  
13:16 <vmassol> but it's all non-xwiki information so you can find all the details with google I'm sure  
13:18 <sburjan> ok, I imagined that the ds is created by XWiki, this is why I was looking at XWiki's code

14:54 <sburjan> vmassol: any idea what are the steps if I want to deploy a webapp in Jetty along with XWiki ?

18:03 <vmassol> sdumitriu: while the idea is good I don't think it's the RM that needs to ensure this  
18:03 <vmassol> I'd prefer we find some tools  
18:03 <sdumitriu1> I know  
18:03 <vmassol> as part of the build  
18:03 <sdumitriu1> It's a lot of work  
18:03 <vmassol> btw on the second point, we still need a discussion  
18:03 <vmassol> because thomas didn't really agree about this point  
18:03 <vmassol> (AFAIr)  
18:03 <vmassol> I proposed it but he said he didn't like it  
18:04 <sdumitriu1> Hm, for @since could be simple with the checkstyle  
18:04 <sdumitriu1> We already check for @version, IIRC  
18:04 <vmassol> yes  
18:05 <sdumitriu1> But it won't work for new methods to existing APIs  
18:05 <vmassol> sonar also knows about new apis  
18:05 <vmassol> so maybe a sonar plugin  
18:05 <vmassol> we need to start thinking in the direction of sonar  
18:06 <vmassol> we could actually replace all our quality checks in the build by sonar checks and sonar alerts/emails  
18:06 <vmassol> (including failing the build by sonar)  
18:06 <vmassol> sonar is there to check on quality aspects  
18:08 <vmassol> sdumitriu: for ex http://sonar.xwiki.org/dashboard/index/1963?did=1&period=3 shows ?11 undocumented APIs in the past 30 days, which is good  
18:08 <vmassol> so it's able to check at the level of methods I believe  
18:12 <vmassol> or just code a new checkstyle rule and make it execute by sonar  
18:12 <vmassol> it's quite easy to add a new checkstyle rule  
18:12 <vmassol> (we do that already btw)  
18:13 <vmassol> or check http://docs.codehaus.org/display/SONAR/Extending+Coding+Rules  
18:13 <vmassol> anyway plenty of possibilities :)  
18:13 <sdumitriu1> Indeed

22:59 <szrrizvi> Hi, I am trying to find a few things about XWiki. Does it offer any sort of access control?  
23:06 <sburjan\_> has joined #xwiki  
23:06 <sburjan\_> has quit  
23:07 <sburjan\_> has joined #xwiki  
23:07 <sdumitriu> szrrizvi: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/RightsManagement  
23:08 <sdumitriu> What kind of Enterprise wiki would that be if it didn't have any access control?  
23:09 <sdumitriu> It's better to try and see what XWiki doesn't have, instead of what it has  
23:09 <szrrizvi> sdumitriu: Thanks. I've come as across some Wikis that offer no access control.  
23:11 <szrrizvi> sdumitriu: Would you know how this access control is managed at the back end? For example, is it done in a Java class? If so, where can I find it.  
23:12 <sdumitriu> That's a lot of code actually  
23:12 <sdumitriu> Several Java classes, manipulating data stored in the database  
23:13 <sdumitriu> What exactly do you want to know?  
23:13 <szrrizvi> So it is done at the database layer, instead of the application layer?  
23:13 <sdumitriu> What?  
23:13 <abusenius> has quit  
23:14 <szrrizvi> I am a student at the University of Calgary, my supervisor and I are working on an Access Control system.  
23:14 <sdumitriu> OK, I think I know what you're asking  
23:14 <sdumitriu> Access rights are stored as metadata (structured objects) attached to documents in the wiki  
23:14 <szrrizvi> I am trying to find out how difficult would it be to change the access control mechanism in XWiki  
23:14 <sdumitriu> XWiki has support for structured data, not just unstructured text  
23:15 <sdumitriu> So there are XWiki.XWikiRights objects, with properties for "list of users", "list of groups", "list of access rights", and "allow or deny"  
23:15 <szrrizvi> This is seeming a bit like TWiki.  
23:15 <sdumitriu> Several such objects are stored in the database  
23:15 <sdumitriu> Yes, XWiki is derived from TWiki  
23:15 <sdumitriu> Well, it did a long time ago, in 2003  
23:15 <szrrizvi> Oh okay, I am familiar with TWiki.  
23:16 <sdumitriu> They're so far away now, I don't know what's left in common except the structured data principle  
23:16 <sdumitriu> It shouldn't be too difficult now, since it has recently been moved to a component  
23:16 <sdumitriu> So there are a few interfaces to implement  
23:17 <szrrizvi> Ok. One of the reasons I'm trying to switch from TWiki is because I'm not very familiar with Perl.  
23:17 <sdumitriu> I'll give you a link soon, a bit busy  
23:17 <sburjan`> has quit

23:17 <szrrizvi> Thank you,  
23:18 <szrrizvi>  I have to head out too, I'll check out the source code a bit, and then return.
